content.raw:
The propshop and gzweb (I think) cannot use urdf. 

The developers for HAPTIX don't need/use ROS. Distributing a model through the model repository is faster than creating debs, easier to update, and available to all gazebo users without installing new packages.
content.html:
The propshop and gzweb (I think) cannot use urdf.

The developers for HAPTIX don't need/use ROS. Distributing a model through the model repository is faster than creating debs, easier to update, and available to all gazebo users without installing new packages.

content.raw:
We can share the meshes without copying, which is the major advantage.

We will have to create a new SDF that copies the links we want.
content.html:
We can share the meshes without copying, which is the major advantage.

We will have to create a new SDF that copies the links we want.

content.raw: huh, you're right, it works but not super elegant with some duplicate xml.
content.html: huh, you're right, it works but not super elegant with some duplicate xml.

content.raw:
But I thought we could distribute via the model repository with URDF just fine since SDF parses URDF natively.
For 2), you're right, the trade off is it's more simulation specific. 3) True, but it's a tool that the developers use(d)? tagging @kapil_katyal
content.html: But I thought we could distribute via the model repository with URDF just fine since SDF parses URDF natively. For 2), you're right, the trade off is it's more simulation specific. 3) True, but it's a tool that the developers use(d)? tagging @kapil_katyal

content.raw: It will probably mean including the STL resources in the other model, but we can't directly <include> this model because that will pull in the links that we don't want--we'll have to copy the links from this model's SDF. Unless there's a way of including only certain links in SDF, or excluding certain links.
content.html: It will probably mean including the STL resources in the other model, but we can't directly <include> this model because that will pull in the links that we don't want--we'll have to copy the links from this model's SDF. Unless there's a way of including only certain links in SDF, or excluding certain links.

content.raw:
Sounds good.
I am used to seeing smaller models and resources included in larger models, but in this case it's the reverse. But sounds like it should work just fine.
content.html: Sounds good. I am used to seeing smaller models and resources included in larger models, but in this case it's the reverse. But sounds like it should work just fine.

content.raw: APL sent us a URDF. I converted it, cleaned up the meshes, and added simple shapes.
content.html: APL sent us a URDF. I converted it, cleaned up the meshes, and added simple shapes.

content.raw: The nice thing about the model repository is that one model can build off of an existing model. The plan is to create a fore-arm only version that uses this model's resources.
content.html: The nice thing about the model repository is that one model can build off of an existing model. The plan is to create a fore-arm only version that uses this model's resources.

content.raw:
The reason I chose SDF was because:

1. It's easy to distribute via the model repository
1. We make use of more of the simulation infrastructure
1. ROS is not needed or used by teams.

That said, anyone if free to make a URDF. However that version cannot go into the gazebo model database, so we'd have to put it in the handsim package.
content.html:
The reason I chose SDF was because:

  1. It's easy to distribute via the model repository
  2. We make use of more of the simulation infrastructure
  3. ROS is not needed or used by teams.

That said, anyone if free to make a URDF. However that version cannot go into the gazebo model database, so we'd have to put it in the handsim package.

content.raw: @nkoenig How was model.sdf created here? Did it come from a xacro expanded unsanitized `apl_description` robot configuration?
content.html: @nkoenig How was model.sdf created here? Did it come from a xacro expanded unsanitized apl_description robot configuration?

content.raw: For haptix, we want just the forearm and below. Should we break this model into separate component models?
content.html: For haptix, we want just the forearm and below. Should we break this model into separate component models?

content.raw: Should we provide URDF instead? Advantages are: 1) it's readily parsed into SDF. 2) others can use it with rviz or any ros related code that reads URDF. 3) current (non-clean) model that we are working with is in URDF, it'll make the transition easier to verify (i.e. against the working model)?
content.html: Should we provide URDF instead? Advantages are: 1) it's readily parsed into SDF. 2) others can use it with rviz or any ros related code that reads URDF. 3) current (non-clean) model that we are working with is in URDF, it'll make the transition easier to verify (i.e. against the working model)?

content.raw: The visual and collision shapes look good, as do the moments of inertial. The link and joint names differ from the current model, which will make porting it to handsim a bit painful. For example, the finger links are named "index0, index1, index2"... whlie the equivalent links in the old model are "rIndDistal, rIndProximal, rIndMetacarpal", etc. It's basically arbitrary if we resolve it now or in the pull request to handsim.
content.html: The visual and collision shapes look good, as do the moments of inertial. The link and joint names differ from the current model, which will make porting it to handsim a bit painful. For example, the finger links are named "index0, index1, index2"... whlie the equivalent links in the old model are "rIndDistal, rIndProximal, rIndMetacarpal", etc. It's basically arbitrary if we resolve it now or in the pull request to handsim.

content.raw:
The wrist appears white to me, while the rest of the model is black. Is this an intentional change in the model or a texture problem?

![mpl_wrist.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3361752062-mpl_wrist.png)
content.html: The wrist appears white to me, while the rest of the model is black. Is this an intentional change in the model or a texture problem?

content.raw: We should not use the upper arm (humerus) in this model. The current apl_description model that we use doesn't have it. I believe that is because the Haptix project focuses on transradial amputees, and the physicals prosthetic arms that will be provided will not extend above the elbow.
content.html: We should not use the upper arm (humerus) in this model. The current apl_description model that we use doesn't have it. I believe that is because the Haptix project focuses on transradial amputees, and the physicals prosthetic arms that will be provided will not extend above the elbow.

content.raw: The model also will need to have the handsim-specific model plugin, HaptixControlPlugin, for it to work in handsim--arm and hand teleop don't work right now if you drop this model into handsim.
content.html: The model also will need to have the handsim-specific model plugin, HaptixControlPlugin, for it to work in handsim--arm and hand teleop don't work right now if you drop this model into handsim.

content.raw: The model is currently referred to as apl_description in handsim. However, mpl_right_arm is a better, more descriptive name, so I think we should change the name in handsim after this PR gets merged.
content.html: The model is currently referred to as apl_description in handsim. However, mpl_right_arm is a better, more descriptive name, so I think we should change the name in handsim after this PR gets merged.
